title: 2012 election : support for Romney and Obama , by ethnic group
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 4 different Races for 2 groups Obama, and Romney that are presented on the X-axis.
For Race Black, Obama had the highest Share of respondents 90.0 among the 2 groups and in Black, Romney had the lowest Share of respondents 5.0.
Race White (non-Hispanic) and Black had the biggest gap of 54.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Romney.
On average, the Race White (non-Hispanic) had the highest Share of respondents for all 2 groups Obama, and Romney. Whereas Nonwhite had the lowest average Share of respondents.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 4 different Races for 2 groups Obama, and Romney that are presented on the X-axis.
For Race Black, Obama had the highest Share of respondents 90.0 among the 2 groups and in Black, Romney had the lowest Share of respondents 5.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 4 different Races for 2 groups Obama, and Romney that are presented on the X-axis.
For Race Black, Obama had the highest Share of respondents 90.0 among the 2 groups and in Black, Romney had the lowest Share of respondents 5.0.
Race White (non-Hispanic) and Black had the biggest gap of 54.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Romney.
On average, the Race White (non-Hispanic) had the highest Share of respondents for all 2 groups Obama, and Romney. Whereas Nonwhite had the lowest average Share of respondents.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Races on X-axis for 2 groups Obama, and Romney. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 2 groups, Obama had the highest Share of respondents for Race Black and Romney had the lowest Share of respondents for Race Black.
For Race White (non-Hispanic), Romney had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Race Black out of all 4 Races.
Race White (non-Hispanic) and Black had the biggest gap of 54.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Romney.
Among all 2 groups, Obama had the gap of 53.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents observed in Race Black and White (non-Hispanic) respectively.
Averaging all 2 groups Obama, and Romney, the Race White (non-Hispanic) is the maximum Share of respondents and Nonwhite is the minimum Share of respondents.
